item.title: Six Invitational 2026 Groups Unveiled by Ubisoft
item.content:encoded:
Ubisoft has revealed the group draw for the Six Invitational 2026, setting the stage for one of the largest esports events in the entire business. What has been uncovered reflects a stunning selection that should make for some exciting match-ups straight out of the gate.

As usual, the tournament begins with four groups of five teams competing for spots in the playoffs. The two-bracket split will be populated by these teams, but not every organization in the group stage will advance to the final round. Four teams will be eliminated before they can make it anywhere close to the final stage.

Six Invitational 2026 Groups Confirmed

The group draw for the Six Invitational 2026 was completed recently by Ubisoft:

Group A:

  • Weibo Gaming
  • M80
  • FEARX
  • Ninjas in Pyjamas
  • Project Zero

Group B:

  • Team Falcons
  • FURIA
  • Elevate
  • Wildcard
  • Daystar

Group C:

  • FaZe Clan
  • G2 Esports
  • Shopify Rebellion
  • DPlus
  • Black Dragons

Group D:

  • Spacestation
  • Team Secret
  • Fluxo W7M
  • ENTERPRISE Esports
  • Oxygen Esports

It could be argued that Group C is the most energetic and unpredictable of the bunch. FaZe Clan, G2, and Shopify Rebellion are all the most legitimate contenders for the trophy, and weâ€™re sure to see sparks fly in Paris before the playoffs even kick off.

Group D is also bursting with potential. Every team there has a credible playoff claim, with Team Secret especially coming in as the Esports World Cup 2025 champions.

As always, the Six Invitational will remain relatively hard to pin down. It has one of the largest single prizes in the esports space, so youâ€™d best believe every team taking to the stage will fight tooth and nail to secure the biggest chunk of it.

Which team do you have taking the win in Paris next month? Let us know your thoughts on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the list of all the games at the Esports World Cup 2026

Grant's passion for gaming started on the Amstrad CPC when he wasn't even old enough to walk properly. Now, he's a multi-platform expert gamer with an undying love for theâ€¦

item.title: Every Esports World Cup 2026 Gameâ€”All Games Confirmed
item.content:encoded:
This yearâ€™s Esports World Cup promises to be the most monumental event in the industryâ€™s history. There are more games, a bigger prize pool, and a wider array of competitors than ever before. The event is set to run in Riyadh from July 6 to August 23, and twenty-four games will share the grandest stages in the business.

Below, weâ€™ve outlined every Esports World Cup game being hosted at the showcase in 2026.

All EWC 2026 Games

From first-person shooters to racing games, and from battle royale titles to MOBAs, there truly is something for everyone at the Esports World Cup 2026.

Hereâ€™s the full list of games with a place at EWC 2026:

  • Apex Legends
  • Call of Duty: Black Ops 7
  • Call of Duty: Warzone
  • Chess
  • Counter-Strike 2
  • Crossfire
  • Dota 2
  • EA Sports FC 26
  • FATAL FURY: City of the Wolves
  • Fortnite
  • Free Fire
  • Honor of Kings
  • League of Legends
  • Mobile Legends: Bang Bang
  • Overwatch 2
  • PUBG: Battlegrounds
  • PUBG Mobile
  • Rocket League
  • Street Fighter 6
  • TEKKEN 8
  • Tom Clancyâ€™s Rainbow Six Siege X
  • Teamfight Tactics
  • Trackmania
  • VALORANT

The newest additions to the lineup this year are Fortnite and Trackmania, both of which are highly anticipated titles with sizeable prize pools. That being said, the entire event boasts a staggering pool, the largest pool in esports history.

While the Esports World Cup Foundation is yet to confirm the full EWC 2026 schedule, just knowing whatâ€™s on the horizon is enough for fans of the event to start getting excited. This is easily the grandest event in the entire esports space.

Will you be watching the Esports World Cup 2026? Let us know what game youâ€™re most excited to see on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the new roadmap for Year 6 of the Apex Legends Global Series

item.title: Tarkov Devâ€™s New Game Could Be Revealed on February 1st
item.content:encoded:
Over the last couple of weeks, the head of the studio at Battlestate Games, Nikita Buyanov, busied himself posting cryptic images and brain teasers on social media. Eventually, an entirely new website surfaced, seemingly hosting some minigame teasing a new project called COR3.

Now, another website has surfaced, this one hosting nothing more than a countdown and a blurry video that, when examined, represents a first-person shooter that scales back to show an entire planet. That countdown expires on February 1st, which is when everyone believes weâ€™ll get something tangible about this game.

What is COR3, and Why is it Exciting?

Nikita Buyanov is one of the creative minds who has directed the growth of Escape from Tarkov over the last decade. He has dedicated his life to the extraction shooter, a fact that he pointed out when we interviewed him as part of a recent episode of Access Granted.

He recently took a cryptic turn on social media, posting stacks of enigmatic images and puzzles, which his followers set to decoding.

Before long, a website had been found, an interactive thing that placed users in some kind of post-apocalyptic bunker with a retro-futuristic computer system bursting with lore, teasers, and world-building elements. As it stands, we have little idea what COR3 is, but the best guess is that itâ€™s Buyanovâ€™s new project.

We say â€˜Buyanovâ€™ and not Battlestate Games, as right now, thereâ€™s no indication that Battlestate is linked to COR3. The COR3 trademark, dug up by eagle-eyed netizens, is in Nikitaâ€™s name, and nobody but the man himself has been sharing content related to COR3 online.

On the countdown website, a clock is running out, and itâ€™s set to expire on February 1st at 3 PM GMT / 10 AM EST. Nobody knows what will happen when that countdown hits zero, but itâ€™s a safe bet that something more tangible will be revealed by Buyanov, and whoever else heâ€™s working with (if anyone).

COR3 appears to represent some kind of alternate reality title set in a universe where Earth suffered from a catastrophic event. Thereâ€™s talk of interplanetary travel, space pirates, and ships adrift in the great beyond, all of which couldnâ€™t be further from Escape from Tarkov, the leading extraction shooter.

Itâ€™s set hundreds of years in the future, but the COR3 website that users could interact with boasted grounded elements like modern-day armor items and traditional computers.

What do you think Nikitaâ€™s new game is? Let us know your thoughts on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the tease for Stellar Blade 2â€™s location

item.title: Destiny 2 Shadow and Order Has Reportedly Been Delayed
item.content:encoded:
Destiny 2â€™s next major update has reportedly been delayed due to the forthcoming release of Marathon, Bungieâ€™s new extraction shooter, in early March.

Destiny 2: Shadow & Order was originally slated for a March 3 release. However, after Bungie officially announced Marathonâ€™s release date on Monday, Forbesâ€™ Paul Tussi reported that the next free Destiny update has been postponed. Thereâ€™s no tentative release window for the content at the moment.

Shadow & Order is slated to be the final major update of the Year of Prophecy season of the game, which started back with the Rite of the Nine in-game event that occurred in May 2025.

While itâ€™s full steam ahead on the marketing push for Marathon, pre-ordering Bungieâ€™s new game scores Destiny players new cosmetics, Sparrows, and Ships. There are also new shaders, emotes, and more in celebration of the upcoming release.

In addition, the marathon marketing push includes a new limited edition PlayStation DualSense and Pulse Elite wireless headset. Learn more about the latest items here.

Are you eager for the next chapter of Destiny 2 to unfold? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, donâ€™t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Insider Gaming has learned first details surrounding The Island in WWE 2K26 as the mode returns for a second year.

Bungie and PlayStation have unveiled a limited edition Marathon-themed DualSense controller and Pulse Elite headset.

Stellar Blade 2 Location Tease Points To Post-Apocalyptic China

In a post on social media, the team at Shift Up have suggested that Stellar Blade 2 will be inspired by post-apocalyptic China.
